column1: RE your inquiries and plans for PMTNM...  so far, no one has volunteered to serve as Honors chair, which was a point in the May 7 letter. As I have said, if no one volunteers for Honors, there will be no need for them in a fall conference,  The conference would require the mandated Board and general membership meetings which can be scheduled anytime.  I will send out another "Help" email in June.  In late July/August, a date can be determined for whatever meetings we need.

This is a busy time of the year with recitals and student evaluations for teachers.  Mid-summer can be planning time again.  No need for busy-ness and stress for us!!
Sharon

column4: October Greetings with a Spooky Note!
column9: Hello!

column1: We hope that you are all doing well this beautiful October!  Attached is
our year schedule that was distributed at our wonderful open house.

Recital which is all outline below on the attached schedule.  Please keep a
copy for future reference as we continue throughout next spring.

on our website.*
*Please do not click on or open any strange emails coming from our
members!  As many of us have already experienced, there is a multitude of
scamming happening that affects all of us.*
We are planning some changes in our website security.  In the meantime,
please be cautious of incoming email, especially if the supposed sender is
asking for any financial information.
We wish all of you the best in this busy season!
Warmest wishes as always,
The Board of the Albuquerque Music Teachers Association

column1: RE your inquiries and plans for PMTNM...  so far, no one has volunteered to serve as Honors chair, which was a point in the May 7 letter. column4: PMTNM Website Analysis and Proposed Redesign
column9: Hi Sharon,

column1: I wanted to share the results of an analysis I finished of music teacher
association websites across the United States.
Process Overview:
1. Downloaded and analyzed content from all 50 state music teacher
association websites
2. Identified common patterns in structure, content organization, and
member services
3. Analyzed current trends in privacy protection and member information
handling
4. Created a proposed redesign for PMTNM that aligns with best practices
I enlisted AI to help do this in just a few hours.
Key Findings:
- Most state associations are moving away from public member directories
toward secure, login-protected systems
- Common focus areas: certification, competitions, and professional
development
- Standard competition structures across states (Elementary through Young
Artist divisions)
- Consistent approach to membership benefits and engagement
I've created a prototype that you can view here:
https://artsmetrics.net/pmtnm/news

column4: PMTNM Website Analysis and Proposed Redesign
column9: Hi Sharon,

column1: I wanted to share the results of an analysis I finished of music teacher
association websites across the United States.
Process Overview:
1. Downloaded and analyzed content from all 50 state music teacher
association websites
2. Identified common patterns in structure, content organization, and
member services
3. Analyzed current trends in privacy protection and member information
handling
4. Created a proposed redesign for PMTNM that aligns with best practices
I enlisted AI to help do this in just a few hours.
Key Findings:
- Most state associations are moving away from public member directories
toward secure, login-protected systems
- Common focus areas: certification, competitions, and professional
development
- Standard competition structures across states (Elementary through Young
Artist divisions)
- Consistent approach to membership benefits and engagement
I've created a prototype that you can view here:
https://artsmetrics.net/pmtnm/news
